languageModelTools.name: agentuity_run_cli
languageModelTools.userDescription: Execute Agentuity CLI commands to manage agents and cloud resources
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Execute an Agentuity CLI command. Use this to run CLI commands like 'cloud agent list', 'cloud session list', 'ai capabilities show', etc. The command should be the subcommand and arguments only, not 'agentuity' itself. Destructive commands (delete, logout) are blocked.

command.description: The Agentuity CLI subcommand and arguments (e.g., 'cloud agent list', 'cloud session list --count 10')

jsonOutput.description: Whether to request JSON output from the CLI (default: true)

languageModelTools.name: agentuity_get_agents
languageModelTools.userDescription: List all AI agents in the current Agentuity project
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Get a list of all AI agents defined in the current Agentuity project. Returns agent names, IDs, identifiers, descriptions, and source files. Use this to understand what agents exist in the project before performing operations on them.

includeDetails.description: Whether to include detailed information about each agent

languageModelTools.name: agentuity_get_project_status
languageModelTools.userDescription: Get the current status of the Agentuity project
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Get comprehensive status information about the Agentuity project including: authentication state, project configuration, dev server state, agent count, and active deployment info. Use this to understand the current state before suggesting actions.

languageModelTools.name: agentuity_get_sessions
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Get a list of recent agent execution sessions. Each session represents one invocation of an agent and includes success/failure status, duration, trigger type, and environment. Use this to diagnose issues or understand agent usage patterns.

count.description: Number of sessions to retrieve (default: 10, max: 100)

languageModelTools.name: agentuity_get_session_logs
languageModelTools.userDescription: Get logs for a specific agent session
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Retrieve detailed logs for a specific agent execution session. Logs include timestamps, severity levels, and messages. Use this to debug agent behavior or diagnose failures. Requires a session ID which can be obtained from agentuity_get_sessions.

sessionId.description: The session ID to get logs for (UUID format)

languageModelTools.name: agentuity_control_dev_server
languageModelTools.userDescription: Start, stop, or check the Agentuity dev server
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Control the Agentuity development server for local agent testing. Actions: 'start' launches the server, 'stop' terminates it, 'restart' cycles it, 'status' returns current state. The dev server must be running to test agents locally via the Workbench.

action.description: The action to perform: start, stop, restart, or status

languageModelTools.name: agentuity_get_deployments
languageModelTools.userDescription: List deployments for the Agentuity project
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Get a list of deployments for the current Agentuity project. Shows deployment IDs, active status, state, creation time, and tags. Use this to understand deployment history and identify the currently active deployment.

limit.description: Maximum number of deployments to return (default: 10)

languageModelTools.name: agentuity_deploy_project
languageModelTools.userDescription: Deploy the Agentuity project to the cloud
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Deploy the current Agentuity project to Agentuity Cloud. This makes the agents publicly accessible. The deployment runs in a terminal and requires user confirmation. Use agentuity_get_project_status first to verify the user is authenticated.

languageModelTools.name: agentuity_get_health_summary
languageModelTools.userDescription: Get a health summary of the Agentuity project
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Get a comprehensive health summary of the Agentuity project including: session success/failure rates, performance metrics (avg/min/max duration), recent failures, deployment status, and dev server state. Use this for monitoring and diagnostics.

sessionCount.description: Number of recent sessions to analyze (default: 20)

walkthroughs.title: Getting Started with Agentuity
walkthroughs.description: Set up the CLI, login, and deploy your first agent.

steps.title: Install the Agentuity CLI
steps.description:
The CLI is required for all Agentuity features.

Run `bun install -g @agentuity/cli` to install.

[Install CLI](command:agentuity.installCli)

steps.title: Login to Agentuity
steps.description:
Authenticate with your Agentuity account.

Run `agentuity auth login` in your terminal.

[Login](command:agentuity.login)

steps.title: Create or Open a Project
steps.description:
Create a new project or open an existing one.

Run `agentuity project new` to create a new project.

[Create Project](command:agentuity.createProject)

steps.title: Start the Dev Server
steps.description:
Run your agents locally.

The dev server lets you test agents locally.

[Start Dev Server](command:agentuity.dev.start)

steps.title: Deploy to Agentuity Cloud
steps.description:
Deploy your agents to production.

Deploy to make your agents available online.

[Deploy](command:agentuity.deploy)
